column1: Severe volitional deficits in depression are documented by exhaustive behavior studies focusing on self-regulation and crippling procrastination; additionally, overwhelming evidence of volitional deficits has been found in comprehensive research on executive functions and in neurobiology.

Three dramatic models of the relation of negative cognitive style to severe depression are outlined: a compelling symptom model, where overwhelming negative cognitions are a striking symptom of depression, a dangerous vulnerability model, where a traumatic life-event in combination with profound cognitive vulnerability leads to depression and an alternative aetiologies model, where depression can be precipitated either by life-altering stressful events or by a pervasive negative cognitive style.
